key_points: President Biden announces a comprehensive strategy to combat COVID-19, including increased vaccine supply and funding.
States, Tribes, and territories will see a 5 percent increase in vaccine supply this week.
The President aims to administer 100 million vaccine shots in 100 days.
Vaccine supply to states, Tribes, and territories will rise to 10.5 million doses weekly, a 22% increase since January 20.
The Administration commits to maintaining this increased supply for at least the next three weeks.
The Federal Retail Pharmacy Program for COVID-19 Vaccination will launch on February 11, offering vaccines through select pharmacies.
21 national pharmacy partners and networks representing over 40,000 locations are involved in this program.
Priority groups will receive vaccinations at no cost in the initial phase, with limited supply.
President Biden directs FEMA to fully reimburse states for COVID-related National Guard Personnel and emergency costs retroactively from the beginning of the pandemic.
The administration estimates retroactive FEMA reimbursements to total $3-5 billion and requests $350 billion from Congress in the American Rescue Plan.
